title: 114_hr108
content: There are no relevant paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. Section 8335a of Title 5, US Code, terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress, effective at the start of the first Congress after enactment. Members will no longer be subject to this subchapter, and no further Government contributions or deductions will be made from their basic pay. The termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress under Section 8335a of Title 5, US Code, results in no further Government contributions or deductions from their basic pay. This does not affect any prior rights, entitlements, or benefits, nor does it impact eligibility to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations may be implemented as needed. Regulations for retirement coverage termination for Members of Congress may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management or the Executive Director for matters related to the Thrift Savings Plan. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in Title 5, US Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress and amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress: Subchapter II of chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code, amended to include section 8425a, which terminates further retirement coverage for Members of Congress effective from the first day of the first Congress after the enactment of this section. The termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress includes provisions for those who complete at least 5 years of service and those who first become a Member after a certain date. The termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress includes provisions for those who complete at least 5 years of service and those who first become a Member after a certain date. No Government contributions or deductions from basic pay may be made for deposit in the Treasury of the United States to the credit of the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. This does not affect any rights, entitlements, or benefits under this chapter for any Member prior to the specified date. It also does not impact the right to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan. The termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress does not affect their eligibility to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. The table of sections in chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include a new section after 8425. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress.
